data.title: Famous Birthdays on May 1
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 1st of May. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on May 1.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 273

John I, Count of Hainaut (1246-57), born in Houffalize, Luxembourg (d. 1257)

1218 Rudolf I, King of Germany, Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire (1273-91), born in Limburgh Castle, Sasbach am Kaiserstuhl, Germany (d. 1291)

Magnus VI Lagabuter, King of Norway (1263-80), born in Tønsberg, Norway (d. 1280)

Edmund FitzAlan, 9th Earl of Arundel, English politician, born in Marlborough Castle, Wiltshire, England (d. 1326)

Franciscus Junius, French-Dutch calvinist theologist and vicar, born in Bourges, France (d. 1602)

Michiel Janszoon van Mierevelt, Dutch royal painter, born in Delft, Netherlands (d. 1641)

François de Kinschot, Dutch jurist and chancellor of Brabant, born in Brussels, Belgium (d. 1654)

Marco da Gagliano, Italian opera composer, born in Florence, Grand Duchy of Tuscany (d. 1643)

Johann Adam Schall von Bell, German missionary in China and astronomer, born in Cologne, Germany (d. 1666)

John Haynes, 5th Governor of the Massachusetts Bay Colony, born in Essex, England (d. 1653)

John Woodward, English geologist known for his collection of fossils and physician, born in Derbyshire (d. 1728)

Joseph Addison

English essayist, playwright (Cato, a Tragedy), poet and Whig politician who co-founded "The Spectator" magazine, born in Milston, Wiltshire, England

James Stirling, Scottish mathematician (Formula of Stirling), born in this month in Stirlingshire, Scotland (d. 1770)

Jan Hendrik van Kinsbergen, Dutch naval officer and founder of Dutch Marines Corp, born in Doesburg, Netherlands (d. 1819)

Kamehameha I

King of Hawaii (1782-1819), born in Kohala, Hawaii

Jacob Albright, German-American Christian leader, founder of Albright's People (Evangelical Association), born in Fox Mountain, Pennsylvania (d. 1808)

Benjamin Henry Latrobe, American architect (completed U.S. Capitol), born in Leeds, Yorkshire, England (d. 1820)

1764 Gottfried Rieger, Czech composer, born in Opavice, Silesia (d. 1855)

Arthur Wellesley

Duke of Wellington and British Prime Minister (Tory: 1828-30), born in Dublin, Ireland

George Guest, English organist and composer, born in Broseley, England (d. 1831)

Jacob-Joseph-Balthasar Martinn, Flemish composer, born in Antwerp, Belgium (d. 1836)

Thomas Aloysius Dornin, American naval officer, born in Ireland (d. 1874)

Guido Gezelle, Flemish priest and poet, born in Brugge, Belgium (d. 1899)

Alfred Napoleon Alexander "Natti" Duffié, French-American Brigadier General (Union Army), born in Paris, France (d. 1880)

Hilaire de Chardonnet, French industrialist and inventor (rayon), born in Besançon, France (d. 1924)

[Robert] Lawson Tait, Scottish-born pioneering surgeon performed first salpingectomy for ectopic pregnancy, born in Edinburgh, Scotland (d. 1899)

Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught and Strathearn, Governor General of Canada (1911-16), born in Buckingham Palace, London (d. 1942)
